description: This represents a first draft of a json-schema for activities to manage follower connections.

id.description: id of the activity, can be assumed to be globally unique. Some activities such as a Follow request will require an id to be valid. Servers may assume an id to be required. As assigning an id is 'trivial', one should assign one.
id.title: Id

to.description: Array of actors this activity is addressed to. It is sane to assume that an activity is addressed to at least one person.
to.title: To

published.description: Moment of this activity or object being published
published.title: Published

type.description: Type of the activity. Side effects of this activity are determine by this type.
type.title: Type

actor.description: id of the actor performing this activity. One can assume that the activity is signed by this actor (in some form).
actor.title: Actor

examples: Actor being followed or blocked or Follow Activity being undone, accepted or rejected
object.title: Object

title: Activity
